p: Japanese encephalitis (JE) is a severe central nervous system disease caused by infection with the Japanese encephalitis virus (JEV). JE represents a significant public health problem in Asia, with an estimated 68,000 cases of JE per year resulting in 15,000 fatalities, mostly in children ( Tsai, 2000) ( Erlanger et al., 2009) ( Campbell et al., 2011). JEV belongs to the genus Flavivirus in the family Flaviviridae and is amplified in a bird and pig-mosquito transmission cycle ( Pierson and Diamond, 2013). The infected mosquitoes, mainly Culex sp., transmit JEV to humans.
